translation: Model for Blur Generation (Pmx)

id: ブレ生成対象モデルPmxファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the Pmx file for the Blur Generation Model

id: ブレ生成対象モデルの使い方
translation:
- You can set the Pmx model where you want to apply the blur setting
- The string in the model name field can be selected
Verification Motion (Vmd/Vpd)

id: 確認用モーション(Vmd/Vpd)ファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the Verification Motion (Vmd/Vpd) file

id: 確認用モーションの使い方
translation:
- You can set any motion Vmd or Vpd
- The string in the model name field in the motion can be selected
Output Model (Pmx)

id: 出力モデル(Pmx)ファイルパスを指定してください
translation: Please specify the file path for the Output Model (Pmx)

- You can set the output file path for the model with the blur setting.
- The output destination is set automatically, but it can be changed to any path
Proceed to Next
Clear Input
Save
Preview
Cancel Preview and Readjust

・Please specify the PMX model where you want to apply the blur settings.
・Motion settings are optional.
・After confirming the model's display, click the 'Next' button at the bottom.

The target model for blur settings has been successfully loaded.
Proceed to the Step.2 tab.

Failed to load the target model for blur settings.
Please confirm that the correct file path is specified.

・Please ensure that only the materials you want to apply the blur settings to are selected.
・In the case of a Japanese sword, select only the materials related to the blade.

The target material for blur settings has been successfully configured.
Proceed to the Step.3 tab.

The target material for blur settings has not been selected.
Please select at least one material for blur settings.

・Select a single vertex at the starting point of the ridge (mune) of the material you want to apply the blur settings to.
・In the case of a Japanese sword, this is the mune-machi area.
・If there are overlapping vertices, they will be displayed separated by commas.
・To deselect a mistakenly selected vertex, hold down the Ctrl key and select it again.

The starting vertex for the ridge for blur settings has been successfully configured.
Proceed to the Step.4 tab.

The starting vertex for the ridge for blur settings has not been selected.
Please select a single vertex at the starting point of the ridge (mune) of the material you want to apply the blur settings to.

・Select a single vertex at the tip of the material you want to apply the blur settings to.
・If there are overlapping vertices, they will be displayed separated by commas.
・To deselect a mistakenly selected vertex, hold down the Ctrl key and select it again.

The target tip vertex for blur settings has been successfully configured.
Proceed to the Step.5 tab.

The target tip vertex for blur settings has not been selected.
Please select a single vertex at the tip of the material you want to apply the blur settings to.

・Please select the vertices of the blade part that you want to display as a blur on the material where you want to apply the blur setting.
・The order of selection is optional. Vertices already selected in Steps 3 and 4 do not need to be selected.
・If there are vertices that overlap in position, they will be displayed separated by commas.
・If you mistakenly select a vertex, you can deselect it by selecting it again while holding down the Ctrl key.

The target edge vertices for blur settings have not been selected.
Please select the vertices of the edge of the material you want to display as blur.
Generation failed
Generation successful

Failed to generate the model with blur settings
Error message: {{.Error}}

Successfully generated the model with blur settings
The preview model is spinning in the preview viewer

【Content to be confirmed】
・Is the blur extending only towards the ridge side?
　　To indicate momentum, the blur material is set to extend only towards the ridge side.
　　(Check that the blur material does not extend in an odd direction)
　　(A red morph has been added to make the blur part more visible)
・Are there any missing vertices in the blur material?
　　The ridge-side vertices are set to extend as blur, while the edge-side vertices follow the main body.
　　If there are holes in the blur material, it indicates a lack of selected edge vertices in Step.5.

If you want to change the settings, click the 'Cancel Preview and Adjust Again' button, the second option in Step.5.
If there are no issues, click the 'Save' button.
Output failed
Output successful

Failed to output the model with blur settings
Error message: {{.Error}}

Successfully output the model with blur settings
By default, the blur material is hidden, so please apply the display morph.
The motion used in the preview has also been output for reference.

{{.Path}}
No output model

id: 出力モデルなしメッセージ
translation:
No output model with blur settings found.
Please redo the preview
Setting failed
Tool Overview

This tool is used to add blur settings to weapons (mainly intended for swords).
Blur is displayed on the ridge side when the sword is swung.
By default, it is hidden, and its transparency is adjusted using morphs.
Additionally, color morphs and AL morphs are created.
Step.1 Overview

Please set the PMX model you want to add blur settings to in the 'Blur Target Model' field.
Setting a confirmation motion is optional
Once the model is displayed correctly, click the 'Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.2 Overview

From all the materials set in the 'Blur Target Model', please ensure that only the materials you want to apply the blur settings to are selected.
Initially, all materials are selected, and deselecting them will make them invisible.
Once only the materials you want to apply the blur settings to are visible, click the 'Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.3 Overview

From the material you want to apply the blur settings to, select the hand vertex on the ridge side (the starting point of the blur direction).
Blur will be generated towards the tip from the selected vertex.
When Step.3 is displayed, the wireframe and vertex selection functions are enabled.
Duplicate vertices (vertices at the same location) are displayed separated by commas.
Once a root vertex has been selected, click the 'Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.4 Overview

From the material you want to apply the blur settings to, select the tip vertex (the endpoint of the blur).
When Step.4 is displayed, the wireframe and vertex selection functions are enabled.
Duplicate vertices (vertices at the same location) are displayed separated by commas.
Once a tip vertex has been selected, click the 'Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.5 Overview

From the material you want to apply the blur settings to, select the edge vertices where you want the blur to appear.
The vertices selected will be used to generate the blur material between the ridge vertex chosen in Step.3 and the tip vertex chosen in Step.4.
The order of selection is optional.
Once the edge vertices selection is complete, click the 'Confirm with Preview' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.5 Preview Overview

id: Step5プレビューメッセージ
translation:
Click the 'Confirm with Preview' button to display the model with blur settings added in the preview viewer.
(Refer to Menu > Viewer > Usage for how to operate the camera)

【Content to be confirmed】
・Is the blur extending only towards the ridge side?
　　To indicate momentum, the blur material is set to extend only towards the ridge side.
　　(Check that the blur material does not extend in an odd direction)
　　(A red morph has been added to make the blur part more visible)
・Are there any missing vertices in the blur material?
　　The ridge-side vertices are set to extend as blur, while the edge-side vertices follow the main body.
　　If there are holes in the blur material, it indicates a lack of selected edge vertices in Step.5.

If you want to change the settings, click the 'Cancel Preview and Adjust Again' button, the second option in Step.5.
If there are no issues, click the 'Save' button.
